labels.analysis: The MCP Server "Blabber" is primarily focused on converting text into high-quality spoken audio using OpenAI's Text-to-Speech (TTS) API. It allows users to select from multiple voices, choose audio formats, save output files locally, and optionally play the audio automatically. This tool enhances LLM (Large Language Model) applications by adding natural voice capabilities, making it particularly useful for accessibility, media creation, and interactive voice applications.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality of this server is centered around text-to-speech conversion, which aligns closely with "Content Creation" as it enables the generation of audio content from text. Additionally, since it leverages AI-powered features (OpenAI's TTS API), the "AI/ML Tools" label is also appropriate. No custom label is necessary as the predefined categories adequately describe the server's functionality.

server_info_crawled.overview: Convert text into high-quality spoken audio using OpenAI's Text-to-Speech API. Choose from multiple voices and audio formats, save the output locally, and optionally play it automatically. Enhance your LLM applications with natural voice capabilities effortlessly.

tools.name: text_to_speech

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@pinkpixel-dev/blabber-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
